After changing the Display view to Mosaic Layout, you can now begin editing the page using Mosaic.

  • On the toolbar menu, click Edit.  The page will appear different from the typical Edit page view.


  •  If this is the first time editing the current item, a Select Layout modal will pop up asking you to choose a layout. 
     

Note: The Layout options are restricted to the layouts applicable to the current content type.  If you are customizing a News Item instead, you’ll get different layout choices. 

 

  • Choose Document to mimic a standard Plone Page layout.
  • There are 4 Editing buttons in the upper left.
    • Save: Saves the page
    • Cancel: Cancels the changes, and leaves the editing view
    • Properties: Changes some properties that are usually found on a regular page
    • Layout: Lets you choose initially to customize the layout or change the layout to another pre-made layout like Basic above. If you customize this, you will later have an option to save your new layout for use in other parts of your site.

 

Exercise: Apply Mosaic's default Document layout

Create a new page and apply Mosaic's Document layout.

Solution

  1. On the toolbar, click Display, then choose Mosaic layout.
  2. On the toolbar, click Edit.
  3. In the Select Layout modal, choose the Document layout.
  4. On the top toolbar, click Save.
